chapters.summary: Squarespace's Courses feature gives you the tools to create and sell your own online course. Socks, underwear and t shirts are the three most requested clothing items in homeless shelters. When you buy yours from Bombas, you're also donating essential items to those who need them.
chapters.gist: Holiday School Course Promotion with Squarespace
chapters.headline: Bomba Socks donate essential items to homeless shelters this holiday season

chapters.summary: There just weren't a lot of middle sized rental buildings in Toronto. In 1912, Toronto banned apartment buildings in most of the city. The term missing middle can be confusing. Cities with lots of middle housing just have more choice in the housing market. Cities without middle housing are harder for pretty much everyone except for the wealthy.
chapters.headline: Toronto has a pronounced lack of mid sized apartment buildings

chapters.summary: Alfred Hawes built Spadina Gardens without a permit in Toronto. The city banned apartment buildings in 1912. Today, the city lacks middle housing that's affordable for middle class families. The lack of middle housing in Toronto has led to a divided city.
chapters.gist: The Toronto apartment building that defied city planning
chapters.headline: Alfred Hawes started building Spadana Gardens without a permit

chapters.summary: Most of the new residences being built are luxury. They only really serve a very narrow range of people. In most places, it's still illegal to build anything except for single family homes. Jason Allen John wants to build affordable housing in communities he cares about. But his dream may never become a reality.
chapters.gist: Toronto's missing middle in the condo market
chapters.headline: Most of the new condos being built in Toronto are luxury and come with hefty fees

chapters.summary: Toronto has a missing middle problem. Cities like Portland have tried to take concrete steps to fix it. Camille Truma worked with the mayor of Portland to pass zoning reform. While zoning reform isn't a silver bullet for a housing crisis, it is a big first step.
chapters.gist: Portland's Fight for the Missing Middle
chapters.headline: Other cities with a missing middle have taken concrete steps to fix it

chapters.summary: Jay Coburn talks about one of the most insane examples of Toronto city planning. The city insists a 17 unit apartment building is actually just two semidetached houses. But legally, nobody can actually live in the apartments. This is part of why a lot of the city is actually getting less dense.
chapters.gist: Toronto's insane plan to turn a 17-unit apartment building into
chapters.headline: Jay Coburn talks about controversial changes to Toronto zoning laws
